questions.text: Which of the following drugs is not used in rheumatoid arthritis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Febuxostat Febuxostat: is a medication used long-term to treat gout due to high uric acid levels. It is generally recommended only for people who cannot take allopurinol. When initially started, medications such as NSAIDs are often recommended FEBUXOSTAT is a xanthine oxidase inhibitor used in gout. Other drugs in the option are used in RA.

Highyeild:

Febuxostat It is a newer nonpurine xanthine oxidase inhibitor, equally or more effective than allopurinol in lowering blood uric acid levels in patients with hyperuricaemia and gout. It is rapidly absorbed orally, highly plasma protein bound, oxidized as well as glucuronide conjugated in the liver and excreted by the kidney; The plasma t½ is ~ 6 hours

Methotrexate Methotrexate: is a chemotherapy agent and immune-system suppressant. It is used to treat cancer, autoimmune diseases, and ectopic pregnancies. Types of cancers it is used for include breast cancer, leukaemia, lung cancer, lymphoma, and gestational trophoblastic disease.

questions.text: Among the following options, which drug is a newer monoclonal antibody approved for Rheumatoid Arthritis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sarilumab Sarilumab: is a human monoclonal antibody medication against the interleukin-6 receptor. Regeneron Pharmaceuticals and Sanofi developed the drug for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

Highyeild:

Sarilumab: (approved May 2017) monoclonal antibody against IL-6 receptor Used in the treatment of adults with rheumatoid arthritis Administered as a subcutaneous injection
